fields.summary: Creating many CF stacks cause no stacks making progress

comments.body:
UPDATE: after about 2 hours (clc was restarted), stacks began to make progress. Many stacks failed and some succeeded. 

STACK	mybucket5	CREATE_COMPLETE	Complete!		2015-09-28T22:05:31.801Z
PARAMETER	BucketName		bucketacct15
STACK	mybucket2	CREATE_COMPLETE	Complete!		2015-09-28T22:05:30.779Z
PARAMETER	BucketName		bucketacct12
STACK	mybucket10	CREATE_FAILED	SCHEDULE_TO_START for activityId="4" of activityType={Name: StackActivity.initCreateResource,Version: 1.0}		2015-09-28T22:05:33.437Z
PARAMETER	BucketName		bucketacct110
STACK	mybucket11	CREATE_FAILED	SCHEDULE_TO_START for activityId="4" of activityType={Name: StackActivity.initCreateResource,Version: 1.0}		2015-09-28T22:05:33.775Z
PARAMETER	BucketName		bucketacct111
STACK	mybucket12	CREATE_FAILED	SCHEDULE_TO_START for activityId="4" of activityType={Name: StackActivity.initCreateResource,Version: 1.0}		2015-09-28T22:05:34.094Z
PARAMETER	BucketName		bucketacct112
To make sure OSG is not an issue, I confirmed that 20 buckets for 100 accounts could be created quickly.

On a different setup, I could see the followings:
  -- when 10 stacks are created for 100 accounts, all of the stacks were completed successfully.
  -- when 20 stacks are created for 100 accounts, some stacks made progress (about 10% of 2000 stacks), but almost all of them failed. For example: 

STACK	mybucket14	CREATE_FAILED	SCHEDULE_TO_START for activityId="3" of activityType={Name: StackActivity.getResourceType,Version: 1.0}		2015-09-29T04:52:22.932Z
PARAMETER	BucketName		bucketacct214
STACK	mybucket11	CREATE_IN_PROGRESS	User Initiated		2015-09-29T04:52:21.018Z
PARAMETER	BucketName		bucketacct211
STACK	mybucket17	CREATE_FAILED	SCHEDULE_TO_START for activityId="3" of activityType={Name: StackActivity.getResourceType,Version: 1.0}		2015-09-29T04:52:24.825Z
PARAMETER	BucketName		bucketacct217
[~spark], let's make sure we document at what scale this test worked (and with what SWF parameters).

Moving this issue to 4.3 as the failure can be addressed via configuration:

{code}
#
# euctl cloudformation.swf_activity_worker_config='{ "PollThreadCount": 8, "TaskExecutorThreadPoolSize": 16, "MaximumPollRateIntervalMilliseconds": 50 }'
cloudformation.swf_activity_worker_config = { "PollThreadCount": 8, "TaskExecutorThreadPoolSize": 16, "MaximumPollRateIntervalMilliseconds": 50 }
#
#
# euctl cloudformation.swf_workflow_worker_config='{ "DomainRetentionPeriodInDays": 1, "PollThreadCount": 8, "MaximumPollRateIntervalMilliseconds": 50 }'
#
{code}

this configuration change increases the throughput of simpleworkflow activity and decision tasks allowing a larger number of stacks to be processed concurrently, I tested 2,500 stacks on a QA setup (1 UFS host). It is still possible to overload the system and see this type of failure, but the configuration change means the failure occurs when a larger number of stacks are being processed. The configuration can be adjusted further if necessary but the above will be the default for 4.3, performance is also impacted by the # of UFS hosts.
[~sjones] I don't see the property 'cloudformation.swf_workflow_worker_config'. Is it expected?
[~sjones] Ok -- it works. It's strange because cloudformation.swf_activity_worker_config is also in JSON but it's shown by default.

[~spark], it is due to the current euctl property type configuration:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/blob/c2175446b366c61a01a0e60c98e3050fb49b81f0/admin-tools/eucalyptus_admin/commands/properties/euctl.py#L44
[~spark], I have not tested with five UFS hosts, the default settings would be a good place to start. We may need to reduce the number of poll threads per host as we add more hosts.

[~sjones] I forgot to add that the log in UFS is filled with this line: 
Thu Jun 23 19:37:53 2016  INFO [SimpleWorkflowService:AbstractListenableFuture: java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker@69873b35[State = -1, empty queue]] Activity task for domain CloudFormationDomain, list CloudFormationTaskList not found

Also occasionally these lines:

Thu Jun 23 18:20:26 2016  INFO [SimpleWorkflowService:AbstractListenableFuture: java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker@31a5d2bf[State = -1, empty queue]] Decision task for workflow a7dc2a42-c698-4256-b9bb-39b147e3cb59 already taken.
Thu Jun 23 18:20:24 2016  INFO [SimpleWorkflowService:AbstractListenableFuture: java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker@691c3c18[State = -1, empty queue]] Decision tas
k for workflow 2899c50b-bfb4-4951-9742-3b031ac63f52 locking error, will retry.

So do you imply that there are contentions between UFS hosts? cc: [~ethomas]

And I feel like there's a separate bug (in addition to slow processing) where all stacks are stuck in one status. By looking the log it appears UFS stopped processing the stacks after a few hours (after 1000 stacks are processed).

[~spark], running with 5 hosts and then also doubling the pollers would likely result in the need to change other configuration settings such as the number of transaction retries after failed updates. When monitoring workflows fail then you can see stacks stuck in particular states.
2000 CF stacks all completed ( 1920 completed successfully and 80 rolled back completely). It took about 40 minutes.
